text: (lighthearted music)
- Over the past decade,
the healthcare and life science industry
has witnessed digital transformation
of medical records data.
However, making sense of this data
requires a lot of structuring

as this data comes in a wide
variety of forms and formats

that are not readily available
for search and analysis.

Organizations are
leveraging machine learning
with purpose-built services,

such as Amazon HealthLake to
help them organize, index,
and structure this information.
In addition to Amazon SageMaker,

that's helping these organizations
be able to build, train

and deploy machine
learning models at scale.

- COVID has been unlike any
other period of my career.

I feel grateful to be able to
have contributed in the way

that I have with the tools
that we've been able to build.
One of the things we found really early on

is that data was a critical
part of the COVID response.

Imagine if at the city
level you could say,
"Well, there's 10 ICU beds or 20,
and here are the hospitals where patients
should get transferred."
The public health data hub

that Rush University
Medical Center has developed

is a way to modernize
the way public health
does surveillance for COVID,

but for diseases of
public health interest.

Amazon HealthLake has been
really interesting for us

because it brings together
disparate data sources,

organizes them and uses
a modern architecture

and allows really advanced
analytics to be done.

And our sense is that's gonna
really just draw an enormous
amount of power to analytics

and what we can do with
the data that we have.
(lighthearted music)

- Our healthcare clients
have to make critical

clinical, operational,
and financial decisions,

and machine learning has
applications in all three areas,

whether you're trying to
predict a disease condition

and advance or predict the
right treatment pathway.

If you're trying to predict
your emergency department

and capacity days out, if
you're trying to predict
your risk of a claim being denied

so that you can stay a
sustainable business.
All of these are gonna be important
and enabled by machine learning.

That's what the Cerner
Machine Learning Ecosystem is.
Last year, we deployed 10 times the amount
that we did in the eight years prior.

This year, we are scheduled
to deploy 10 times more
than what we did last year.
We couldn't do it without Amazon SageMaker

and a slew of other
AWS services and tools.

Another clinical model that we
were trying to scale rapidly
with our infrastructure,
our Cerner Machine Learning Ecosystem
is our Opioid Use Disorder Predictor.
- Cerner collaborated

with AWS to create the Opioid
Use Disorder Predictor,

to really bring awareness
and to be able to predict
for those patients

who are coming in through
the emergency department
of who could be at risk of creating

or having an opioid use disorder
within the next six months.
(lighthearted music)

- Machine learning is enabling
healthcare and life science

companies realize more value
out of their information

and they can leverage the
cloud to be able to scale

with regards to advancing
science, advancing drug discovery,
or be able to manage populations
and therefore be able to deliver
better, higher quality, affordable care.
